header.title: The Book of Unbound Gods and Revised Enochian Keys for Satanic Operation
authors: Anonymous (revisions based on original Enochian calls and Anton Szandor LaVey's Satanic Bible)
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Satanism, Grimoire Tradition

central_thesis: The foundational Enochian Keys, even as presented by Anton Szandor LaVey, contain elements inadvertently praising the 'xian god' (Yaweh/Jehova). To align with Satanic philosophy and maximize magical efficacy, these keys, along with other invocations, must be thoroughly revised in both English and Enochian to explicitly blaspheme Yaweh/Jehova and praise Satan/Lucifer, thereby ensuring HIS victory and empowering the practitioner through precise phonetic chanting and vibration.

structure_content.summary: A comprehensive list of 72 distinct entities, referred to as 'unbound gods,' each provided with their phonetic pronunciation for direct invocation and study. These entities are presented as a foundational element for broader magical operation.

This section introduces the Enochian Keys, their historical context within Anton LaVey's Satanic Bible, and critically analyzes their original content. The author argues that LaVey's versions, particularly the Enochian text, retain Christian theological biases, thereby praising the 'xian god' rather than Satan. The necessity for a complete revision of these keys to serve a Satanic agenda is established.

A powerful invocation to the 'Bornless One,' explicitly identified as Lucifer, is presented. This invocation, provided in both English and its Enochian translation, is reworded to praise Lucifer as the creator and supreme deity, emphasizing themes of light, darkness, and distinction, and including a list of various demonic and dark divine names to be invoked.

structure_content.chapter_title: Ye Induyinge of Ye Unholy Vestures & Spirit Invocation
structure_content.summary: Short invocations designed to 'gird up power' in 'hell fire' and to call upon specific entities (Sabazios, Shaitan, Shiva, Supay, Tezcatlipoca, Thamuz, Typhone, Yaotzin, Sekhmet, Set) for power and eternal hell fire. A general invocation structure for a specific 'Spirit N' is also provided, emphasizing the practitioner's authority in the name of Satan and various associated deities.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Nineteen Enochian Keys (Revised and Pronounced)
structure_content.summary: The core of the practical system, presenting each of the nineteen Enochian Keys. For each key, the revised English text is followed by its Enochian translation and a detailed phonetic pronunciation guide. These keys are systematically reworded to exclusively praise Satan/Lucifer, blaspheme Yaweh/Jehova, and assert Satanic dominion, serving as direct operational tools for the practitioner.

An extensive Enochian-English dictionary, crucial for understanding and crafting further magical texts within the system. It includes Enochian words, numbers, and their English equivalents. Additionally, specific pronunciation guidelines are provided for Enochian, detailing the rolling of 'R's, soft 'J's, and stressing final 'L's, essential for maximizing the keys' power through chanted vibration.

key_concepts.definition: The original Enochian Keys, which the author claims were corrupted by Christian elements even in LaVey's Satanic Bible, have been rewritten in both English and Enochian. These revisions aim to explicitly praise Satan/Lucifer and blaspheme Yaweh/Jehova, thereby re-aligning their magical power with a Satanic paradigm.

A central philosophical and operative tenet. The act of openly insulting and denigrating Yaweh/Jehova within the revised keys is not merely symbolic but is intended to empower Satan and the practitioner, ensuring 'HIS victory' and subverting traditional spiritual authority.

The primary method of reciting Enochian texts. It involves hitting and maintaining a mono-tone pitch, with specific instructions for rolling 'R's, using a soft 'J' sound, and stressing final 'L's. This technique is believed to drastically increase the magical power of the invocations.

A mandatory prerequisite for anyone intending to use these revised keys. The author explicitly warns that neglecting this ritual could make the keys 'dangerous for the uninitiated,' suggesting a protective or initiatory function to prepare the practitioner for the potent forces invoked.

The supreme divine entity within this system, who validates the author's revisions and bestows power. Lucifer is also invoked as the 'Bornless One' and the ultimate creative force, receiving the praise and allegiance of the practitioner.

A separate, but related, list of 72 entities, likely derived from Goetic traditions. These 'unbound' gods are presented with phonetic pronunciations, implying their direct invocation and interaction as part of the broader magical practice, free from traditional constraints or 'binding' rituals.

practical_system.description: The system offers a comprehensive framework for Satanic/Luciferian magic, centered on the invocation of 'unbound gods' and the ceremonial recitation of 19 Revised Enochian Keys. Its core innovation lies in the ideological revision of historical Enochian material to explicitly praise Satan/Lucifer and blaspheme Yaweh/Jehova, transforming it into a tool for adversarial spiritual practice. Emphasis is placed on specific phonetic pronunciation and vibratory chanting techniques to enhance magical potency, supported by an extensive Enochian dictionary for deeper engagement and custom ritual construction.
tools: The text itself, containing the revised Enochian Keys, invocations, and entity lists.
Phonetic pronunciation guides for all Enochian words to ensure correct vibratory chanting.
An Enochian-English dictionary for comprehension, study, and the creation of new ritual texts.
A prior 'dedication ritual' (details not provided in the excerpt) as an initiatory safeguard and energetic alignment tool.
rituals: Recitation of the 19 Revised Enochian Keys (English, Enochian, phonetic pronunciation).
Bornless One Invocation (Luciferian adaptation) for invoking Lucifer as the supreme creator.
General Invocation of a specific 'Spirit N' (demon) using prescribed formulas and divine names.
Performance of a 'dedication ritual' as a mandatory prerequisite to safeguard the practitioner and align them with the system's energies.
Vibratory chanting of Enochian texts at a mono-tone pitch, following strict phonetic rules, to generate and direct magical energy.

relevant_quotes.text: Most Satanists know the Enochian Keys through the Satanic Bible, written by Anton Szandor LaVey. Many use the keys during ritual and in prayer. Unbeknownst to most people, Anton LaVey never revised the keys in Enochian, though he changed the English words in most, but not all of them, to conform to Satanism.
The keys on this website have been revised BOTH in English and in Enochian and reworded to blaspheme yaweh/jehova and praise Satan and ensure HIS victory.
Father Satan came to visit me a couple of times during the revisions and told me he was very pleased and this was long overdue. He also stated that most of us are unaware of the power of the keys.

Enochian is chanted and vibrated. The objective is to hit a mono-tone pitch and maintain it. This drastically increases its power. ALL of the R's should be rolled- the tongue vibrated against the palate. ALL J's are pronounced as a soft J, such as the French Jacques, the Hindu Raja. (jzh). The letter 'L' at the end of a word should be stressed.
The JoS Ministry strongly advises any who uses these keys in ritual or in prayer, to have already performed the dedication ritual as they may otherwise be dangerous for the uninitiated.
I reign over you, saith Satan/Lucifer In power exalted above the firmaments And over the earth; in whose hands The sun is as a sword And the moon as a thorough-thrusting fire

critical_analysis.relevance: This work is highly relevant within modern Satanic and Luciferian currents, particularly for those seeking operative magical systems directly aligned with anti-theistic or adversarial spiritual paths. It critically engages with and attempts to 'de-Christianize' established occult material, offering a revised framework for practitioners who reject traditional Abrahamic influences. Its detailed phonetic guides and dictionary make it a practical manual for implementing its specific form of Enochian magic, providing a counter-narrative and alternative practice to mainstream Enochian traditions.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of practitioners of modern Satanism, Luciferianism, and various forms of demonolatry. It also appeals to occultists interested in grimoire traditions, Enochian magic (especially from an adversarial perspective), and those engaged in the revision or re-contextualization of magical texts for specific ideological or spiritual purposes. The explicit warning for the 'uninitiated' suggests an internal, perhaps initiatory, audience who has undertaken foundational commitments to the JoS Ministry's path.
